title: Automated Spotify playlist organizer - sort and queue tracks by popularity
description:
üéß Automated Spotify Playlist Organizer ‚Äî Sort and Queue Tracks by Popularity

üß† Overview

This workflow acts as your AI-powered Spotify DJ assistant.
It retrieves your playlists, cleans and organizes them, sorts tracks by popularity, and automatically queues them for playback ‚Äî creating a ready-to-play, personalized listening session.

‚∏ª

‚öôÔ∏è Step-by-Step Breakdown

1. Manual Trigger

Node: When clicking ‚ÄòExecute workflow‚Äô
Starts the workflow manually when you click ‚ÄúExecute‚Äù in n8n.

‚∏ª

2. Get User‚Äôs Playlists

Node: Get a user‚Äôs playlists
	‚Ä¢	Uses your Spotify OAuth credentials.
	‚Ä¢	Calls Spotify‚Äôs API to retrieve all playlists from your account (returnAll: true).
	‚Ä¢	Output: an array of playlists (name, URI, number of tracks, etc.).

üü¢ This is your raw data source.

‚∏ª

3. Clean & Deduplicate

Node: Clean & Deduplicate (Code node)
This JavaScript block:
	‚Ä¢	Normalizes input (handles arrays and multiple items).
	‚Ä¢	Extracts only useful fields: name, uri, total.
	‚Ä¢	Filters out playlists missing data.
	‚Ä¢	Removes duplicates by URI.

üßπ Result: a clean, uniform list of your playlists.

‚∏ª

4. Get a Playlist‚Äôs Tracks

Node: Get a playlist‚Äôs tracks by URI or ID
	‚Ä¢	Fetches all tracks from a specific playlist.
	‚Ä¢	Returns detailed info: name, popularity, artists, album, added date, etc.

üéµ This retrieves the actual songs from your chosen playlist.

‚∏ª

5. Playlist Reorganizer

Node: Playlist reorganizer (Code node)
This JavaScript block:
	‚Ä¢	Collects all tracks from the selected playlist.
	‚Ä¢	Avoids duplicates with seenTrackIds.
	‚Ä¢	Extracts key fields: id, name, popularity, artists, album, added_at, url, etc.
	‚Ä¢	Sorts songs by ascending popularity (less popular first).

üìä Result: playlist reorganized by song popularity.

‚∏ª

6. Loop Over Items

Node: Split in Batches
	‚Ä¢	Iterates over each track one by one.
	‚Ä¢	Sends each song sequentially to the next node (‚ÄúAdd a song to a queue‚Äù).

üîÅ Allows each song to be processed individually.

‚∏ª

7. Add a Song to a Queue

Node: Add a song to a queue
	‚Ä¢	Uses each song‚Äôs Spotify ID to add it to your Spotify playback queue (spotify:track:{{ $json.id }}).
	‚Ä¢	Connected to the ‚ÄúLoop Over Items‚Äù node to continue until all songs are queued.

üé∂ Result: your Spotify queue fills automatically with the reorganized tracks.

‚∏ª

‚úÖ Final Result

When you execute this workflow:
	1.	It fetches all your playlists.
	2.	Cleans and filters them.
	3.	Extracts tracks from one selected playlist.
	4.	Sorts them by popularity.
	5.	Adds them to your playback queue.

üéß End result: a fully automated ‚ÄúAI DJ‚Äù that reorganizes your playlists and lines up your music session ‚Äî from discovery to playback.

‚∏ª

ü™™ Prerequisites

Before using this workflow:
	‚Ä¢	You must have a Spotify account.
	‚Ä¢	You need to set up Spotify OAuth credentials in n8n (Client ID, Client Secret, Redirect URI).
	‚Ä¢	Ensure you have Spotify Premium (API queueing only works on Premium accounts).

‚∏ª

üõ†Ô∏è Setup Instructions
	1.	Import this workflow into your n8n instance.
	2.	Go to the Spotify OAuth2 API credentials section and connect your account.
disclaimer: This workflow is provided as-is. Please review and test before using in production.
